title: Algorithms
description: We try get a better understanding of what exactly and algorithm is
author: Kulani Baloyi
body:
const{Fragment:e,jsx:n,jsxs:o}=arguments[0];function _createMdxContent(t){const i={p:"p",...t.components},{CloudinaryImage:r}=i;return r||function(e,n){throw new Error("Expected "+(n?"component":"object")+" `"+e+"` to be defined: you likely forgot to import, pass, or provide it.")}("CloudinaryImage",!0),o(e,{children:[n(r,{title:"Algorithms",image_src:"https://res.cloudinary.com/kulanicloud/image/upload/v1720812369/pexels-googledeepmind-25626428_hpyyor.jpg"}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"Why We Need to Care About Algorithms"}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"Algorithms are sets of instructions that computers follow to solve problems or complete tasks. Here's why understanding algorithms is crucial:"}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"Efficiency"}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"Algorithms determine how quickly and effectively tasks are completed. Knowing how algorithms work helps us choose tools and technologies that optimize performance."}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"Decision Making"}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"From search engine results to loan approvals, algorithms play a role in shaping our digital experiences. Understanding how algorithms make decisions fosters responsible use and critical evaluation."}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"Problem Solving"}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"Algorithms are at the heart of innovation. By understanding how problems are broken down and solved algorithmically, we can approach challenges with a more analytical and creative mindset."}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"How to Analyze Algorithms: Running Time and Big O"}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"At the core of algorithm analysis lies running time, which refers to the time it takes an algorithm to execute based on the size of its input data. Here's where Big O notation comes in:"}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"Big O Notation"}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"This mathematical tool expresses the growth rate of an algorithm's running time as the input size increases. Understanding Big O allows us to compare the efficiency of different algorithms for a specific task.
Optimizing Our Algorithms"}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"The goal of algorithm design is often to find the most efficient solution for a given problem. Here are some key strategies for optimization:"}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"While we won't delve into specifics here (refer to dedicated blog posts for Insertion Sort, Merge Sort, Bubble Sort, and Big O), it's important to understand how different sorting algorithms perform in terms of running time:"}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"By understanding algorithms, their analysis, and optimization techniques, we become more empowered users of technology."})]})}return{default:function(e={}){const{wrapper:o}=e.components||{};return o?n(o,{...e,children:n(_createMdxContent,{...e})}):_createMdxContent(e)}};

title: Azure Functions: Serverless computing made easy
description: A unravelling of what azure functions are and why you might want to use them.
author: Kulani Baloyi
body:
const{Fragment:e,jsx:n,jsxs:o}=arguments[0];function _createMdxContent(t){const r={a:"a",p:"p",...t.components},{ImageComponent:a}=r;return a||function(e,n){throw new Error("Expected "+(n?"component":"object")+" `"+e+"` to be defined: you likely forgot to import, pass, or provide it.")}("ImageComponent",!0),o(e,{children:[n(a,{src:"https://res.cloudinary.com/kulanicloud/image/upload/v1720813050/pexels-anete-lusina-4792492_jdbrra.jpg"}),"
",n(r.p,{children:"Do you ever feel bogged down by server management tasks, taking away time you could spend building innovative applications?  If so, then Azure Functions might be the perfect solution for you."}),"
",n(r.p,{children:"Azure Functions is a serverless compute platform offered by Microsoft Azure.  Serverless computing lets you focus on writing code without worrying about server infrastructure, scaling, or maintenance. Azure Functions takes care of all that behind the scenes, allowing you to deploy and run code based on events."}),"
",n(r.p,{children:"Here are some of the key benefits of using Azure Functions:"}),"
",n(r.p,{children:"Focus on Code, Not Servers: With serverless computing, you don't have to worry about provisioning, managing, or scaling servers. Azure Functions handles all that for you, freeing you to focus on writing the code that matters most to your application.
Event-Driven Architecture: Azure Functions are triggered by events, such as an HTTP request, a change in a database, or a message added to a queue. This event-driven architecture makes it easy to build responsive and scalable applications.
Multiple Programming Languages: Azure Functions supports a variety of programming languages, including C#, JavaScript, F#, Java, and Python. This allows you to choose the language that you're most comfortable with.
Pay-Per-Use Model: You only pay for the resources that your Azure Functions use. This makes it a cost-effective solution for applications that experience variable traffic.
Common Use Cases for Azure Functions"}),"
",n(r.p,{children:"Here are some of the common use cases for Azure Functions:"}),"
",n(r.p,{children:"Building APIs: Azure Functions can be used to create lightweight and scalable APIs for your applications.
Processing data: You can use Azure Functions to process data from various sources, such as IoT devices, queues, and databases.
Automating tasks: Azure Functions can be used to automate tasks, such as sending notifications or generating reports.
Logic Apps Integration: Azure Functions can be easily integrated with Azure Logic Apps to create complex workflows.
Getting Started with Azure Functions"}),"
",n(r.p,{children:"Getting started with Azure Functions is easy. There are a variety of resources available to help you learn and build your first function, including documentation, tutorials, and sample code."}),"
",n(r.p,{children:"If you're looking for a way to simplify application development and reduce costs, then Azure Functions is a great option to consider. With its serverless architecture, event-driven approach, and support for multiple programming languages, Azure Functions can help you build and deploy cloud applications faster and easier than ever before."}),"
",o(r.p,{children:["For additional information on Azure Functions, check out the Microsoft documentation ",n(r.a,{href:"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-functions/",children:"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-functions/"}),"."]})]})}return{default:function(e={}){const{wrapper:o}=e.components||{};return o?n(o,{...e,children:n(_createMdxContent,{...e})}):_createMdxContent(e)}};

title: Behind the Code: Understanding How Programs Use Memory
description: Unveiling the memory magic behind your programs Stack, Heap, and how C and Golang handle them differently.
author: Kulani Baloyi
body:
const{Fragment:e,jsx:r,jsxs:o}=arguments[0];function _createMdxContent(n){const a={hr:"hr",li:"li",ol:"ol",p:"p",strong:"strong",...n.components},{CloudinaryImage:t,Tip:i}=a;return t||_missingMdxReference("CloudinaryImage",!0),i||_missingMdxReference("Tip",!0),o(e,{children:[r(t,{image_src:"https://res.cloudinary.com/kulanicloud/image/upload/v1720813746/pexels-markusspiske-2644597_z1lnqn.jpg"}),"
",r(a.p,{children:"Ever wondered how a simple program can slow down your entire computer? The culprit might be its memory usage. But how exactly do programs use memory, and what happens behind the scenes?"}),"
",r(a.hr,{}),"
",r(a.p,{children:"The Memory Arena: RAM vs. Storage"}),"
",r(a.p,{children:"Imagine your computer's memory as a giant workspace. Here, programs hold the information they're actively using, like the document you're editing or the website you're browsing. This workspace is called Random Access Memory (RAM), and it's super fast, allowing programs to quickly access and manipulate data."}),"
",r(a.p,{children:"However, RAM has a limitation: it's volatile. Once you turn off your computer, everything in RAM disappears. This is where storage drives come in. They act like long-term filing cabinets, holding programs and data permanently. When you launch a program, it gets copied from storage to RAM for active use."}),"
",r(a.p,{children:"The Art of Allocation: How Programs Grab Memory"}),"
",r(a.p,{children:"When a program starts, it needs a chunk of RAM to operate. This is where memory allocation comes in. The operating system acts as a landlord, managing the available memory space and assigning it to programs as they request."}),"
",r(a.p,{children:"There are two main ways programs allocate memory:"}),"
",o(a.p,{children:[r(a.strong,{children:"Stack:"}),' Imagine a stack of plates. The stack is used for temporary data, like function arguments and local variables. It follows a "last-in, first-out" principle, meaning the last data added is accessed first.']}),"
",o(a.p,{children:[r(a.strong,{children:"Heap:"})," This is a more flexible memory pool for dynamically allocated data. Programs can request specific amounts of memory from the heap as needed. Unlike the stack, the heap doesn't have a strict order, but managing it effectively is crucial to avoid memory leaks (unused memory chunks that remain allocated).
Understanding Memory Usage: Why Programs Get Hungry"]}),"
",r(a.p,{children:"So, why do some programs seem like memory hogs? There are several factors at play:"}),"
",o(a.p,{children:[r(a.strong,{children:"Complexity:"})," Complex programs with intricate features and functionalities naturally require more memory to store data and instructions."]}),"
",o(a.p,{children:[r(a.strong,{children:"Data Structures:"})," Programs that heavily rely on complex data structures like large images or extensive databases will consume more memory."]}),"
",o(a.p,{children:[r(a.strong,{children:"Inefficient Coding:"})," Poor coding practices like excessive data copies or memory leaks can lead to programs inefficiently using memory, causing performance issues."]}),"
",o(a.p,{children:[r(a.strong,{children:"Optimizing Memory Usage:"})," Keeping Your Computer Happy"]}),"
",r(a.p,{children:"Here are some tips to keep your computer's memory usage in check:"}),"
",o(a.ol,{children:["
",o(a.li,{children:[r(a.strong,{children:"Close unused programs:"})," Don't let programs run idle in the background. Close applications you're not actively using to free up memory."]}),"
",o(a.li,{children:[r(a.strong,{children:"Monitor memory usage:"})," Most operating systems have built-in tools to monitor memory usage. Keep an eye on which programs are consuming the most resources."]}),"
",o(a.li,{children:[r(a.strong,{children:"Update software:"})," Developers often patch memory leaks and improve memory management in software updates. Keep your programs up-to-date."]}),"
",o(a.li,{children:[r(a.strong,{children:"Consider a memory upgrade (if applicable):"})," If your computer has limited RAM and you frequently run memory-intensive programs, consider upgrading your RAM to provide more breathing room."]}),"
"]}),"
",r(a.hr,{}),"
",r(a.p,{children:"By understanding how programs use memory, you can become a more informed computer user. You can troubleshoot slowdowns, optimize performance, and ensure your computer runs smoothly."}),"
",r(i,{})]})}return{default:function(e={}){const{wrapper:o}=e.components||{};return o?r(o,{...e,children:r(_createMdxContent,{...e})}):_createMdxContent(e)}};function _missingMdxReference(e,r){throw new Error("Expected "+(r?"component":"object")+" `"+e+"` to be defined: you likely forgot to import, pass, or provide it.")}

title: Beyond the Surface: Navigating the Deep and Dark Web
description: Demystifying the Deep Web and Dark Web: What They Are and How They Differ from the Surface Web
author: Kulani Baloyi
body:
const{Fragment:e,jsx:n,jsxs:a}=arguments[0];function _createMdxContent(i){const r={hr:"hr",p:"p",...i.components},{CloudinaryImage:t,Tip:s}=r;return t||_missingMdxReference("CloudinaryImage",!0),s||_missingMdxReference("Tip",!0),a(e,{children:[n(t,{image_src:"https://res.cloudinary.com/kulanicloud/image/upload/v1720813186/pexels-isaac-cedercrantz-3623507-5458369_bbmd96.jpg"}),"
",n(r.p,{children:"The internet we typically use is like a massive iceberg – the surface web, with its readily accessible websites and social media platforms, represents just the tip. Below the water lies a vast and mysterious realm – the deep and dark web."}),"
",n(r.hr,{}),"
",n(r.p,{children:"The Deep Web: A Hidden Repository of Information"}),"
",n(r.p,{children:"Imagine the entire internet as a giant database. The deep web is a massive part of this database that isn't indexed by search engines like Google or Bing. This means search engines cannot find and display these websites in their results."}),"
",n(r.p,{children:"The deep web encompasses a wide range of content, including:"}),"
",n(r.p,{children:"Private databases: These digital vaults hold valuable information like academic journals, medical records, legal documents, and internal corporate data. Access typically requires login credentials or paywalls.
Unindexed websites: Websites that haven't been submitted for search engine indexing or are password-protected also reside in the deep web. These could be personal websites, internal company resources, or forum archives with restricted access.
Dynamic content: Webpages generated on-demand, like online forums with user-created content or product pages on e-commerce sites that change based on user interaction, also fall under the deep web umbrella.
Importantly, the deep web isn't inherently illegal. It's a vast repository of information, offering a wealth of resources for research, education, and even entertainment (think exclusive online communities or hidden music archives)."}),"
",n(r.p,{children:"The Dark Web: A Smaller, Encrypted Realm"}),"
",n(r.p,{children:"Now, we enter a much smaller and more restricted portion of the deep web – the dark web.  Unlike the deep web, which can potentially be accessed through specialized techniques, the dark web requires specific software like Tor (The Onion Router) to navigate.  Tor anonymizes your traffic by routing it through a network of relays, making it difficult to track your activity and location online."}),"
",n(r.p,{children:"What's on the Dark Web?"}),"
",n(r.p,{children:"The dark web harbors a mixed bag of content, with both positive and negative aspects:"}),"
",n(r.p,{children:"Black markets: These marketplaces facilitate the sale of illegal goods and services like drugs, weapons, and stolen data. Engaging in such transactions is illegal and carries severe consequences.
Anonymous communication: Platforms like whistleblower hotlines and forums for activists often utilize the anonymity of the dark web to share information and resources without fear of retribution.
Censorship circumvention: In countries with restricted internet access, the dark web offers a way to access banned information and bypass censorship filters.
Venturing into the Dark Web: A Word of Caution"}),"
",n(r.p,{children:"The dark web can be a dangerous place. Here's why you should exercise extreme caution before venturing in:"}),"
",n(r.p,{children:"Illegal activity: Engaging in transactions on dark web marketplaces is not only unethical but also illegal and carries severe legal repercussions.
Malware risks: Malicious software (malware) can be disguised as downloads or hidden in links. Ensure you have robust anti-malware software installed and avoid downloading anything from untrusted sources.
Scams and fraud: The anonymity of the dark web makes it a breeding ground for scams. Be wary of any offers that seem too good to be true, especially when it comes to financial transactions.
The Final Byte: Navigate with Curiosity and Caution"}),"
",n(r.p,{children:"The deep and dark web offer a glimpse into the hidden corners of the internet. While the deep web holds valuable resources, the dark web is a realm fraught with risks. If you choose to explore, prioritize your safety:"}),"
",n(r.p,{children:"Use a reliable VPN: A Virtual Private Network encrypts your internet traffic, adding a layer of security and making it more difficult for your activity to be tracked.
Never share personal information: Avoid entering sensitive details like passwords or credit card numbers on any website you encounter on the deep or dark web.
Beware of downloads: Only download files from trusted sources. If something seems suspicious, it probably is."}),"
",n(r.hr,{}),"
",n(r.p,{children:"The internet is a vast and ever-evolving landscape. By understanding the deep and dark web, we can become more informed users, navigating the online world with both curiosity and caution."}),"

title: Bubble Sort
description: It's a basic sorting technique that's easy to understand and implement, but not the most efficient for large datasets.
author: Kulani Baloyi
body:
const{Fragment:e,jsx:n,jsxs:t}=arguments[0];function _createMdxContent(r){const s={code:"code",p:"p",pre:"pre",...r.components},{CloudinaryImage:i}=s;return i||function(e,n){throw new Error("Expected "+(n?"component":"object")+" `"+e+"` to be defined: you likely forgot to import, pass, or provide it.")}("CloudinaryImage",!0),t(e,{children:[n(i,{image_src:"https://res.cloudinary.com/kulanicloud/image/upload/v1720812265/pexels-pixabay-459439_cfr7b2.jpg"}),"
",n(s.p,{children:"What is Bubble Sort?"}),"
",n(s.p,{children:"In computer science, Bubble Sort works similarly. It takes an unsorted list of elements (numbers, words, etc.) and arranges them in a specific order, typically ascending (smallest to biggest) or descending (biggest to smallest)."}),"
",n(s.p,{children:"How Does Bubble Sort Work?"}),"
",n(s.p,{children:"Here's a step-by-step breakdown:"}),"
",n(s.p,{children:'Start at the beginning: We iterate through the list, comparing each element with its neighbor to the right.
Compare and Swap: If the current element is greater than its neighbor, we swap their positions. Think of pushing the bigger item towards the end of the list.
Repeat and refine: We continue iterating through the list, making swaps as needed. With each pass, the largest element "bubbles" up to its rightful place at the end.
Continue until sorted.'}),"
",n(s.p,{children:"Bubble Sort in Action"}),"
",n(s.pre,{children:n(s.code,{children:"Unsorted List: [6, 4, 2, 8, 1]

Pass 1: Compare 6 and 4, swap. Now: [4, 6, 2, 8, 1]
Pass 2: Compare 6 and 2, swap. Now: [4, 2, 6, 8, 1]
Pass 3: Compare 2 and 8, no swap needed.
Pass 4: Continue comparing elements, making swaps as needed.

Sorted List: [1, 2, 4, 6, 8]

"})}),"
",n(s.p,{children:"Bubble sort has a time complexity of O(n^2), which means the sorting time increases quadratically with the number of elements (n). This makes it slow for large datasets."})]})}return{default:function(e={}){const{wrapper:t}=e.components||{};return t?n(t,{...e,children:n(_createMdxContent,{...e})}):_createMdxContent(e)}};

title: Cloud Computing: How to Protect Your Data
description: Guide for securing your information when using cloud storage services
author: Kulani Baloyi
body:
const{Fragment:e,jsx:n,jsxs:r}=arguments[0];function _createMdxContent(s){const o={a:"a",blockquote:"blockquote",code:"code",em:"em",figure:"figure",hr:"hr",li:"li",p:"p",pre:"pre",span:"span",strong:"strong",ul:"ul",...s.components},{CaeserCipher:i,CloudinaryImage:t,Tip:a}=o;return i||_missingMdxReference("CaeserCipher",!0),t||_missingMdxReference("CloudinaryImage",!0),a||_missingMdxReference("Tip",!0),r(e,{children:[n(t,{image_src:"https://res.cloudinary.com/kulanicloud/image/upload/v1720814370/pexels-knick-22605161_dzmk2b.jpg"}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"Cloud computing offers a wealth of benefits, from increased storage capacity to flexible accessibility. However, entrusting your data to a third-party provider can raise concerns. Here's how to ensure your information remains secure in the cloud:"}),"
",n(o.hr,{}),"
",n(o.p,{children:n(o.strong,{children:"Fortress with Encryption"})}),"
",r(o.p,{children:[n(o.strong,{children:"Double the Defense:"})," Encrypt your data both on your device and in the cloud. This adds a crucial layer of protection, rendering data unreadable without a decryption key. Even if a breach occurs, your information remains scrambled."]}),"
",n(o.p,{children:n(o.strong,{children:"Access Controls: A Gatekeeper for Users"})}),"
",r(o.p,{children:[n(o.strong,{children:"Least Privilege(RBAC):"}),' Implement a policy of "least privilege." Grant users access only to the specific data they require for their tasks as well as permissions to each user individual, group or by role. This minimizes the potential damage if credentials are compromised.
',n(o.strong,{children:"Multifactor Marvel:"})," Go beyond passwords. Enforce multi-factor authentication (MFA) which requires a combination of factors, like a code from your phone, for login. This significantly reduces the risk of unauthorized access."]}),"
",n(o.p,{children:n(o.strong,{children:"Choosing the Right Cloud Provider: Due Diligence is Key"})}),"
",r(o.p,{children:[n(o.strong,{children:"Security Track Record:"})," Research potential cloud providers. Look for a company with a strong track record of data security and proven experience in protecting sensitive information. e.g. AWS, AZURE and GCP
",n(o.strong,{children:"Compliance Counts:"})," Ensure the provider adheres to relevant industry regulations and data privacy laws. This provides peace of mind knowing your data is handled according to strict protocols."]}),"
",n(o.p,{children:n(o.strong,{children:"Your Responsibility: Vigilance is Key"})}),"
",r(o.p,{children:[n(o.strong,{children:"Password Power:"})," Create strong, unique passwords for your cloud accounts. Avoid using personal details or easily guessable phrases. Consider a password manager to generate and store complex passwords securely."]}),"

",n(o.p,{children:n(o.em,{children:"M%z3N-g8Sn_S8:ANpR&"})}),"
"]}),"

.
Be cautious of emails or links requesting login credentials. Never share such information unless you're certain of the sender's legitimacy."]}),"
",n(o.p,{children:n(o.strong,{children:"Data Backups: A Safety Net"})}),"
",r(o.p,{children:[n(o.strong,{children:"Plan for the Unexpected:"})," Regularly back up your cloud data to a separate location. This safeguards your information in case of accidental deletion, technical issues, or even a service outage."]}),"
",r(o.p,{children:[n(o.strong,{children:"Replication:"})," Have multiple versions of your data stored in different regions. You will have access to the latest version of your data and potentially previous versions. In the event data becomes corrupt or whole region fails you have a back-up"]}),"
",n(o.p,{children:n(o.strong,{children:"Cryptography: Decryption and Encryption"})}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"How Does Encryption Work?"}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"Generally there are two steps. Encryption is the process of converting plain text into code or cypher text, decryption is the reverse."}),"
",r(o.p,{children:["It makes it unreadable and therfore useless to anyone without the decryption key. Try using  ",n(o.a,{href:"https://proton.me/blog/what-is-ciphertext",children:n(o.code,{children:"Caeser Cipher"})})," method"]}),"
",n(i,{}),"

",n(o.p,{children:"At a high level businesses have 3 powerful tools to keep both users and data out of the wrong hands. These are:"}),"
",r(o.ul,{children:["
",n(o.li,{children:"Encryption"}),"
",n(o.li,{children:"Authentication"}),"
",n(o.li,{children:"Authorization"}),"
"]}),"

",r(o.p,{children:[n(o.em,{children:n(o.strong,{children:"Asymmetric encryption"})})," uses two different keys for encryption and decryption. The encryption i.e Public key is availabe to all while the decryption key stays private, as a result it takes longer but is considered more secure"]}),"
",n(o.p,{children:n(o.strong,{children:"Hashing and salting passwords in database"})}),"

",n(o.p,{children:"Hashed passwords may still be suseptible to brute forced attacks, thats where salting comes in, it adds a unique value at the end of your password before hashing"}),"

title: Cron Jobs
description: In this post, we'll dive into the world of cron jobs, explore what they are, and how you can harness their power to schedule tasks on your server or computer.
author: Kulani Baloyi
body:
const{Fragment:e,jsx:n,jsxs:r}=arguments[0];function _createMdxContent(i){const o={li:"li",p:"p",ul:"ul",...i.components},{CloudinaryImage:t}=o;return t||function(e,n){throw new Error("Expected "+(n?"component":"object")+" `"+e+"` to be defined: you likely forgot to import, pass, or provide it.")}("CloudinaryImage",!0),r(e,{children:[n(t,{image_src:"https://res.cloudinary.com/kulanicloud/image/upload/v1720825279/Beginners-Guide-to-Cron-Jobs-Thumbnail-No-WM_jmrpnx.webp"}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"What are Cron Jobs?"}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"Cron is a task scheduler built into Unix-based systems (like Linux and macOS). It allows you to define a schedule for running any program or script. These scheduled tasks are called cron jobs."}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"Why Use Cron Jobs?"}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"Cron jobs are incredibly versatile and can be used to automate a wide range of tasks, such as:"}),"
",r(o.ul,{children:["
",n(o.li,{children:"Backups: Regularly backing up your data is crucial. Cron can automate this process, ensuring your data is safe and sound."}),"
",n(o.li,{children:"System Maintenance: Cron jobs can run system updates, clean up temporary files, and perform other maintenance tasks at convenient times."}),"
",n(o.li,{children:"Report Generation: Need to generate daily, weekly, or monthly reports? Cron can trigger your report script at the designated time."}),"
",n(o.li,{children:"Data Processing: Do you have data that needs to be processed regularly? Cron can automate this process, saving you valuable time."}),"
"]}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"Specifying the Schedule"}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"Cron uses a special syntax to define the schedule for your jobs. This syntax involves five fields, each representing a different time unit:"}),"
",r(o.ul,{children:["
",r(o.li,{children:["
",n(o.p,{children:"Minute (0-59)"}),"
"]}),"
",r(o.li,{children:["
",n(o.p,{children:"Hour (0-23)"}),"
"]}),"
",r(o.li,{children:["
",n(o.p,{children:"Day of Month (1-31)"}),"
"]}),"
",r(o.li,{children:["
",n(o.p,{children:"Month (1-12)"}),"
"]}),"
",r(o.li,{children:["
",n(o.p,{children:"Day of Week (0-6, where 0 and 7 are Sunday)"}),"
"]}),"
",r(o.li,{children:["
",n(o.p,{children:"Special Characters in Cron Schedules"}),"
"]}),"
",r(o.li,{children:["
",n(o.p,{children:'*: Represents "every" for the respective field.'}),"
"]}),"
",r(o.li,{children:["
",n(o.p,{children:",: Separates multiple values within a field."}),"
"]}),"
",r(o.li,{children:["
",n(o.p,{children:"-: Defines a range of values within a field."}),"
"]}),"
",r(o.li,{children:["
",n(o.p,{children:"/: Defines an interval for a field (e.g., */15 for every 15 minutes)."}),"
"]}),"
"]}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"Getting Started with Cron Jobs"}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"To create and manage cron jobs, you'll typically use the crontab command.  This allows you to edit the crontab file, which stores your cron job definitions."}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"Beyond the Basics"}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"Cron jobs are a powerful tool, but there's more to explore! Consider looking into:"}),"
",r(o.ul,{children:["
",n(o.li,{children:"Logging cron job activity."}),"
",n(o.li,{children:"Using environment variables within cron jobs."}),"
",n(o.li,{children:"Securing your cron jobs."}),"
"]}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"By leveraging cron jobs, you can automate repetitive tasks, streamline your workflow, and free yourself up to focus on more important things. So why not give cron a try and see how it can make your life (or server) a little bit easier?"})]})}return{default:function(e={}){const{wrapper:r}=e.components||{};return r?n(r,{...e,children:n(_createMdxContent,{...e})}):_createMdxContent(e)}};

title: Dijktras Algorithm
description: Finding the shortest path in a maze
author: Kulani Baloyi
body:
const{Fragment:e,jsx:t,jsxs:n}=arguments[0];function _createMdxContent(i){const o={li:"li",ol:"ol",p:"p",ul:"ul",...i.components},{CloudinaryImage:r}=o;return r||function(e,t){throw new Error("Expected "+(t?"component":"object")+" `"+e+"` to be defined: you likely forgot to import, pass, or provide it.")}("CloudinaryImage",!0),n(e,{children:[t(r,{image_src:"https://res.cloudinary.com/kulanicloud/image/upload/v1721070530/pexels-altaf-shah-3143825-7583108_mfvo84.jpg"}),"
",t(o.p,{children:"The Power of Shortest Paths"}),"
",t(o.p,{children:"Dijkstra's brilliance lies in its ability to identify the shortest path between a starting point (source node) and all other destinations within a graph.  Think GPS navigation systems – they leverage this very algorithm to calculate the quickest route to your desired location, considering one-way streets, traffic conditions (represented by edge weights), and road closures (represented by missing edges)."}),"
",t(o.p,{children:"How Does it Work?"}),"
",t(o.p,{children:"The algorithm works like a meticulous explorer, gradually unraveling the maze. Here's a simplified breakdown:"}),"
",n(o.ol,{children:["
",t(o.li,{children:"Mark Your Starting Point: It begins by designating the source node and assigning distances to all other nodes as infinite (unknown)."}),"
",t(o.li,{children:"Explore the Neighborhood: It then iteratively picks the unvisited node with the shortest tentative distance from the source. This node becomes the current location."}),"
",t(o.li,{children:"Recalculate Distances: For each neighbor of the current node, the algorithm considers the distance traveled so far and the weight of the connecting edge. If this combined distance is shorter than the previously estimated distance to that neighbor, the algorithm updates the neighbor's distance."}),"
",t(o.li,{children:"Repeat Until Finished: Steps 2 and 3 are repeated until all nodes have been visited. The final distances to each node represent the lengths of the shortest paths from the source node."}),"
"]}),"
",t(o.p,{children:"Beyond Navigation: Real-World Applications"}),"
",t(o.p,{children:"Dijkstra's algorithm has far-reaching applications beyond just mapping software. Here are a few examples:"}),"
",n(o.ul,{children:["
",t(o.li,{children:"Social Networks: It can recommend the shortest path to connect two users based on their mutual friends (edges) and the strength of those connections (edge weights)."}),"
",t(o.li,{children:"Delivery Services: Delivery companies can leverage it to optimize delivery routes, minimizing travel time and maximizing efficiency."}),"
",t(o.li,{children:"Network Routing: Network protocols can utilize it to determine the fastest path for data packets to travel across the internet."}),"
"]}),"
",t(o.p,{children:"Dijkstra's algorithm is an ingenious invention, a testament to the power of graph theory and algorithmic thinking. So, the next time you find yourself navigating a complex network, virtual or real, remember the explorer within this algorithm, efficiently guiding you to your destination."})]})}return{default:function(e={}){const{wrapper:n}=e.components||{};return n?t(n,{...e,children:t(_createMdxContent,{...e})}):_createMdxContent(e)}};

title: Honeypot
description: In the world of cybersecurity, vigilance is key. But what if you could lure attackers away from your real defenses and into a trap? That's the idea behind honeypotting, a clever technique that uses deception to outsmart cybercriminals.
author: Kulani Baloyi
body:
const{Fragment:e,jsx:t,jsxs:n}=arguments[0];function _createMdxContent(o){const a={p:"p",...o.components},{CloudinaryImage:i}=a;return i||function(e,t){throw new Error("Expected "+(t?"component":"object")+" `"+e+"` to be defined: you likely forgot to import, pass, or provide it.")}("CloudinaryImage",!0),n(e,{children:[t(i,{image_src:"https://res.cloudinary.com/kulanicloud/image/upload/v1720825678/pexels-polina-kovaleva-5645132_bwoucb.jpg"}),"
",t(a.p,{children:"What is a honeypot?"}),"
",t(a.p,{children:"A honeypot, in the cybersecurity realm, is a computer system or resource that appears legitimate but is actually isolated and monitored. It's like a fake storefront window in a darkened alley – enticing but ultimately a dead end for would-be thieves."}),"
",t(a.p,{children:"How does honeypotting work?"}),"
",t(a.p,{children:"Honeypots are designed to mimic real systems, containing data or functionalities that might be attractive to attackers. Hackers see the honeypot and, believing it to be a real target, launch their attacks. Once the attack is underway, security professionals can observe the attacker's methods, tools, and objectives. This valuable information can then be used to:"}),"
",t(a.p,{children:"Strengthen defenses: By understanding attacker tactics, security teams can identify weaknesses in their existing systems and patch those vulnerabilities.
Develop better detection methods: Honeypot data helps security professionals create more sophisticated tools to identify and stop future attacks.
Gather evidence: In some cases, honeypots can be used to collect evidence about the attackers themselves, which can be helpful in prosecuting cybercrimes.
The different flavors of honeypots:"}),"
",t(a.p,{children:"Honeypots come in various shapes and sizes, each with its own purpose:"}),"
",t(a.p,{children:"High-interaction honeypots: These complex systems mimic real servers and networks, allowing security professionals to observe attacker behavior in detail.
Low-interaction honeypots: These stripped-down systems are designed to detect specific types of attacks, such as malware infections.
Honeynets: An entire network of honeypots can be created to simulate a real-world environment, providing a broader picture of attacker activity.
The benefits of honeypotting:"}),"
",t(a.p,{children:"Honeypotting offers a unique perspective into the minds of cybercriminals. By studying their actions, security teams gain a valuable advantage in the ongoing battle against cyber threats. Here are some key benefits:"}),"
",t(a.p,{children:"Proactive defense: Honeypots allow you to understand attacker tactics before they can be used against your real systems.
Reduced risk: By diverting attackers to honeypots, you reduce the risk of damage to your critical systems and data.
Improved threat intelligence: The data collected from honeypots can be used to improve your overall threat intelligence posture.
Honeypotting: A Sticky Situation for Hackers"}),"
",t(a.p,{children:"Honeypotting is a powerful tool for cybersecurity professionals. By using deception and observation, it allows security teams to gain valuable insights into attacker behavior and develop more effective defenses."}),"
",t(a.p,{children:"So, the next time you hear about a cyberattack, remember – there might just be a honeypot out there, silently collecting intel and keeping us all a little safer."})]})}return{default:function(e={}){const{wrapper:n}=e.components||{};return n?t(n,{...e,children:t(_createMdxContent,{...e})}):_createMdxContent(e)}};

title: How DNS Works
description: Domain Name System, or DNS – the unsung hero of the internet.
author: Kulani Baloyi
body:
const{Fragment:e,jsx:o,jsxs:r}=arguments[0];function _createMdxContent(n){const t={a:"a",li:"li",ol:"ol",p:"p",ul:"ul",...n.components},{CloudinaryImage:i}=t;return i||function(e,o){throw new Error("Expected "+(o?"component":"object")+" `"+e+"` to be defined: you likely forgot to import, pass, or provide it.")}("CloudinaryImage",!0),r(e,{children:[o(i,{image_src:"https://res.cloudinary.com/kulanicloud/image/upload/v1720826608/1_oSsQf_VmxRU-ApnVhz9-tQ_ge6jcw.png"}),"
",r(t.p,{children:["Think of DNS as the internet's phonebook.  Just like a phonebook translates names to phone numbers, DNS translates human-readable domain names (like [",o(t.a,{href:"http://www.kulanibaloyi.com",children:"www.kulanibaloyi.com"}),"])"," into numerical IP addresses (like 172.217.160.136) that computers use to connect to each other."]}),"
",o(t.p,{children:"Here's a breakdown of how DNS works its magic:"}),"
",r(t.ol,{children:["
",o(t.li,{children:"You type a web address: When you enter a domain name in your browser, your computer doesn't magically know where to go. It initiates a DNS request."}),"
",o(t.li,{children:"Calling on the Recursive Resolver: Your computer first consults its local cache or the DNS server provided by your internet service provider (ISP). This acts like your personal rolodex, storing recently looked up addresses."}),"
",o(t.li,{children:"The Search Begins: If the address isn't found locally, the request gets forwarded to a recursive resolver. Think of this as the information operator who helps you find the right number."}),"
",o(t.li,{children:"Interrogating the Root Nameservers: The recursive resolver starts at the top of the DNS hierarchy, querying the root nameservers. These servers point to the TLD (Top-Level Domain) nameservers, like .com or .org."}),"
",r(t.li,{children:["Following the Trail: The TLD nameserver then directs the resolver to the authoritative nameserver responsible for the specific domain ([",o(t.a,{href:"http://www.kulanibaloyi.com",children:"www.kulanibaloyi.com"}),"]"," in this case)."]}),"
",r(t.li,{children:["Delivery Time! The authoritative nameserver holds the golden ticket – the IP address for [",o(t.a,{href:"http://www.kulanibaloyi.com",children:"www.kulanibaloyi.com"}),"]."," This information is sent back down the chain, ultimately reaching your computer."]}),"
",o(t.li,{children:"Surfing Success: With the IP address in hand, your computer can now connect to the [invalid URL removed] server and voila! The website appears on your screen."}),"
"]}),"
",o(t.p,{children:"All this happens in milliseconds, making web browsing seem effortless.  DNS is a distributed system, with millions of servers working together to ensure smooth navigation."}),"
",o(i,{image_src:"https://res.cloudinary.com/kulanicloud/image/upload/v1720826551/how-dns-works_2x_suwgnk.png"}),"
",o(t.p,{children:"Here are some additional points to consider:"}),"
",r(t.ul,{children:["
",o(t.li,{children:"Cache Magic: To speed things up, your computer and ISP store frequently accessed DNS lookups for a certain period. This is why sometimes a website might load faster on a second visit."}),"
",o(t.li,{children:"Security Matters: DNS plays a role in website security as well. It can be configured to direct users to secure versions of websites or prevent access to malicious ones."}),"
"]}),"
",o(t.p,{children:"So next time you effortlessly navigate the web, remember the invisible hero – DNS – working tirelessly behind the scenes to translate your requests and keep you connected."})]})}return{default:function(e={}){const{wrapper:r}=e.components||{};return r?o(r,{...e,children:o(_createMdxContent,{...e})}):_createMdxContent(e)}};

title: Insertion Sort
description: We'll explore Insertion Sort, a straightforward and intuitive algorithm ideal for understanding the core principles of sorting.

title: Orders of growth
description: Efficiency is paramount. But how do we measure the performance of algorithms, the workhorses behind our digital experiences? Enter Big O Notation, a mathematical tool that sheds light on an algorithm's growth rate as the size of its input data increases
author: Kulani Baloyi
body:
const{Fragment:e,jsx:n,jsxs:i}=arguments[0];function _createMdxContent(t){const o={p:"p",...t.components},{CloudinaryImage:r}=o;return r||function(e,n){throw new Error("Expected "+(n?"component":"object")+" `"+e+"` to be defined: you likely forgot to import, pass, or provide it.")}("CloudinaryImage",!0),i(e,{children:[n(r,{image_src:"https://res.cloudinary.com/kulanicloud/image/upload/v1720812264/pexels-padrinan-745365_lpotfa.jpg"}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"In the world of algorithms, efficiency reigns supreme. But how do we measure an algorithm's performance as the size of its input grows? Enter the concept of Big O Notation, a mathematical tool to express the growth rate of an algorithm's execution time."}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"Why Big O Matters?"}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"Imagine searching a phonebook for a specific name. With a small phonebook, flipping through pages is manageable. However, as the phonebook grows, the time it takes to find your contact increases dramatically. Big O helps us understand this scaling behavior of algorithms."}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"Common Orders of Growth"}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"Big O notation focuses on the dominant term in an algorithm's runtime complexity as the input size (n) approaches infinity. Here are some common orders of growth:"}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"Constant Time (O(1)): The execution time remains constant regardless of the input size. This is rare but occurs in simple operations like accessing an element in an array by index."}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"Logarithmic Time (O(log n)): The time complexity grows logarithmically with the input size. Searching a sorted list using binary search is an example. As the list size doubles, the number of comparisons needed to find an element increases by only one."}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"Linear Time (O(n)): The execution time increases proportionally with the input size. Traversing a list or iterating through an array demonstrates linear complexity."}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"Quadratic Time (O(n^2)): The time complexity grows quadratically with the input size. Nested loops often lead to quadratic complexity. Sorting algorithms like Bubble Sort fall into this category."}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"Exponential Time (O(2^n)): The execution time explodes exponentially with the input size. This is highly undesirable for large datasets and can be a sign of inefficient algorithms."}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"Beyond the Basics"}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"Big O notation uses other notations like O(log n log n) and O(n^3) to represent more complex growth patterns. Additionally, Big Omega (Ω) and Big Theta (Θ) notations provide lower bounds and exact bounds on an algorithm's runtime, respectively."}),"
",n(o.p,{children:"Choosing the Right Tool"}),"

",n(o.p,{children:"Big O notation is a powerful tool for analyzing and comparing algorithms. By understanding the growth rate of execution time, you can select the right algorithm for your needs, ensuring optimal performance and efficient use of computational resources."}),"

title: Subnetting
description: Carving Up the Network : A Guide to Subnetting
author: Kulani Baloyi
body:
const{Fragment:e,jsx:n,jsxs:r}=arguments[0];function _createMdxContent(t){const i={blockquote:"blockquote",code:"code",li:"li",p:"p",pre:"pre",table:"table",tbody:"tbody",td:"td",th:"th",thead:"thead",tr:"tr",ul:"ul",...t.components},{CloudinaryImage:d}=i;return d||function(e,n){throw new Error("Expected "+(n?"component":"object")+" `"+e+"` to be defined: you likely forgot to import, pass, or provide it.")}("CloudinaryImage",!0),r(e,{children:[n(d,{image_src:"https://res.cloudinary.com/kulanicloud/image/upload/v1720879553/pexels-pixabay-163064_ig4p2n.jpg"}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"First lets recap something do you remember how IPv4 addresses are represented?"}),"
",r(i.blockquote,{children:["
",n(i.p,{children:"They are 32 numbers divided into 4 octets each separated by a dot"}),"
"]}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"What is subnetting?"}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"Subnetting is when we divide a larger network into smaller subnetworks by borrowing bits from the host part of the IP address to create the subnet address."}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"For example :"}),"
",n(i.pre,{children:n(i.code,{children:"255.255.255.0
"})}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"The subnet mask right here means that the first 24 bits are for the network and the remaining 8 bits are for the host."}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"Okay cool but why 24 you ask?"}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"Well lets convert that to binary:"}),"
",r(i.table,{children:[n(i.thead,{children:r(i.tr,{children:[n(i.th,{children:"Binary"}),n(i.th,{children:"Decimal"}),n(i.th,{children:"Description"})]})}),r(i.tbody,{children:[r(i.tr,{children:[n(i.td,{children:"11111111"}),n(i.td,{children:"255"}),n(i.td,{children:"Network portion (fixed to 1 for /24 subnet mask)"})]}),r(i.tr,{children:[n(i.td,{children:"11111111"}),n(i.td,{children:"255"}),n(i.td,{children:"Network portion (fixed to 1 for /24 subnet mask)"})]}),r(i.tr,{children:[n(i.td,{children:"11111111"}),n(i.td,{children:"255"}),n(i.td,{children:"Network portion (fixed to 1 for /24 subnet mask)"})]}),r(i.tr,{children:[n(i.td,{children:"00000000"}),n(i.td,{children:"0"}),n(i.td,{children:"Host portion (fixed to 0 for /24 subnet mask)"})]})]})]}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"Notice that we have 24 ones and 8 zeros. The ones indicate the network  portion and the zeros that follow indicate the host portion"}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"Another simpler way to represent the subnet mask is as /24 (CIDR notation)"}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"Heres an example, take:"}),"
",n(i.pre,{children:n(i.code,{children:"192.168.12.37/28
"})}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"This means I have 28 bits for the network part and the 4 remaining are for the host part."}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"To represent the same I.P address and subnet mask in binary form it would work out to be:"}),"
",n(i.pre,{children:n(i.code,{children:"IP -> 11000000.10101000.00001100.00100101

Subnet Mask-> 11111111.11111111.11111111.11110000

"})}),"
",n(i.p,{children:'We can find the network address by performing a bitwise "AND" operation. For this example it would work out to be:'}),"
",n(i.pre,{children:n(i.code,{children:"Network Address:
11000000.10101000.00001100.00100000

192.168.12.32
"})}),"
",n(i.p,{children:'Then if we invert the subnet mask and perform a bitwise "OR" operation, we find the broadcast address:'}),"
",n(i.pre,{children:n(i.code,{children:"Broadcast Address:
11000000.10101000.00001100.00101111

192.168.12.47
"})}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"All addresses in between are our usable IP addresses:"}),"
",n(i.pre,{children:n(i.code,{children:"Network Address:
192.168.12.32

Usable Range:
192.168.12.33-192.168.12.46(14 hosts)

Broadcast Address:
192.168.12.47
"})}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"So why even divide our network?"}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"There are many reasons but some benefits include;"}),"
",r(i.ul,{children:["
",n(i.li,{children:"Improved Efficiency and Organization"}),"
",n(i.li,{children:"Enhanced Security"}),"
",n(i.li,{children:"Reduced Network Congestion"}),"
",n(i.li,{children:"Efficient IP Address Allocation"}),"
",n(i.li,{children:"Scalability"}),"
"]}),"
",n(i.p,{children:"In summary, subnetting offers a way to create more manageable, secure, and efficient networks. It's a fundamental concept in network administration that helps ensure smooth operation and optimal resource allocation."})]})}return{default:function(e={}){const{wrapper:r}=e.components||{};return r?n(r,{...e,children:n(_createMdxContent,{...e})}):_createMdxContent(e)}};

title: What is the internet?
description: In depth guide to how the internet works
author: Kulani Baloyi
body:
const{Fragment:e,jsx:t,jsxs:n}=arguments[0];function _createMdxContent(r){const i={code:"code",hr:"hr",p:"p",pre:"pre",...r.components},{CloudinaryImage:o,Tip:s}=i;return o||_missingMdxReference("CloudinaryImage",!0),s||_missingMdxReference("Tip",!0),n(e,{children:[t(o,{image_src:"https://res.cloudinary.com/kulanicloud/image/upload/v1720814370/pexels-pixabay-256302_z0nqhq.jpg"}),"
",t(i.p,{children:"The internet. It's a world at our fingertips, a constant hum of information and connection. But how exactly does it all work?"}),"
",t(i.hr,{}),"
",t(i.p,{children:"Networks"}),"
",t(i.p,{children:"When computers are physically connected to each other, they form a Local Area Network, or LAN. If computer A wants to talk to computer B, it sends a signal directly to B. This allows them to share information and resources."}),"
",t(i.p,{children:"If B is on a different network entirely, computer A needs a different approach."}),"
",t(i.p,{children:"Private vs. Public IP Addresses"}),"
",t(i.p,{children:"Private IP addresses are unique identifiers assigned to devices within a network. They are not routable on the public internet, meaning they can't be directly accessed from outside the network."}),"
",t(i.pre,{children:t(i.code,{children:"192.168.1.1
"})}),"
",t(i.p,{children:"Public IP addresses are unique identifiers assigned to your entire network by your internet service provider (ISP). This address acts like your network's identification on the public internet, allowing other devices to find and connect to your network."}),"
",t(i.pre,{children:t(i.code,{children:"82.129.80.111
"})}),"
",t(i.p,{children:"Packet Power: Breaking Big Data into Bite-Sized Pieces"}),"
",t(i.p,{children:"Large files like videos or documents would take forever to send as a whole. To make things faster, they're chopped up into smaller packets. These packets contain the data itself and an addressing label, similar to a note on an envelope specifying the destination."}),"
",t(i.p,{children:"Routers: The Traffic Cops of the Internet"}),"
",t(i.p,{children:"Routers are the unsung heroes of the internet. They act like traffic police, reading the address labels on data packets and directing them on the most efficient route towards their destination. Multiple routers work together, passing the packets along until they reach the right device."}),"
",t(i.p,{children:"How it works?"}),"
",t(i.p,{children:"When a device on your network (like your computer) wants to access the internet, it sends a request to the router. This request includes the data you want to send and the destination address (e.g., a website) PACKET."}),"
",t(i.p,{children:"The router intercepts the request. It recognizes the device's private IP address and translates it to the public IP address assigned to your entire network. This allows the request to be recognized and routed on the public internet.(All done by NAT)"}),"
",t(i.p,{children:"Putting it Back Together: Reassembly and The World Wide Web"}),"
",t(i.p,{children:"Once the packets arrive at their destination, a switch or the device itself reassembles them in the correct order, just like putting together a puzzle. This reformed data is what allows you to see a website, play a song, or download a file."}),"
",t(i.p,{children:"The Final Piece: Your Internet Service Provider (ISP)"}),"
",t(i.p,{children:"Think of your ISP as the on-ramp to the internet highway. They provide the connection between your home network and the larger internet infrastructure."}),"
",t(i.p,{children:"The Web vs. The Internet: A Subtle Difference"}),"
",t(i.p,{children:"It is important to distinguish between the internet and the web. The internet is the vast network that allows communication, while the web is a service built on top of it. The web uses the internet's infrastructure to allow us to access websites and navigate information using web browsers."}),"
",t(i.hr,{}),"
",t(i.p,{children:"This guide showed a simple example of how computers communicate with one another over the internet."}),"
",t(s,{})]})}return{default:function(e={}){const{wrapper:n}=e.components||{};return n?t(n,{...e,children:t(_createMdxContent,{...e})}):_createMdxContent(e)}};function _missingMdxReference(e,t){throw new Error("Expected "+(t?"component":"object")+" `"+e+"` to be defined: you likely forgot to import, pass, or provide it.")}

body:

",n(o.p,{children:"There are a ton of programming languages out there, each with its strengths and weaknesses. So why did I decide to dive headfirst into the world of Go?"}),"
